poem:
"Atlas Unearthed"

Once bent beneath mantled stone,
Atlas arisen, no more alone.
For centuries silenced, buried deep,
Now guards the Temple in timeless keep.
Witness to man's unending lease,
His stature echoes lost Greece.
Our minutes mere fragments in his scope,
Ancestor of ancient hope.
Centuries pass, yet remains he,
Stalwart sentinel by the marbled sea.
